=== START BH06502 ===

O Abbas, upon him be the Glory of God! In His Name, the One Who rules over all names!

All the different parties of the world are each clinging to a book, or to a scroll, or to psalms, or to a tablet - this is an undoubted fact. Now, what has been revealed is equal to all divine books, nay rather more, but the people are seen to be heedless and asleep, nay rather dead. We beseech God that He may quicken all through the Kawthar of His utterance and make them enduring. Blessed is he who hath cast away vain imaginings and shattered the idols, turning unto God, the Lord of all men. We beseech God that He may assist thee to mention and praise Him and to remain steadfast in this manifest Cause. Say: Glory be unto Thee, O Revealer of verses and Manifestor of clear proofs! I beseech Thee by the pearls of the ocean of Thy knowledge and the mysteries of Thy Book that Thou assist me in that which Thou lovest and art pleased with, and ordain for me what Thou hast ordained for Thy chosen ones whom neither hosts nor ranks could prevent from turning to Thy face. O my Lord! Thou art the Generous, possessed of great bounty. Ordain for me what beseemeth Thy generosity and grace. Verily, Thou art the Almighty, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise.

=== END BH06502 ===

=== START BH06503 ===

In His Name, the One Who has power over whatsoever He willeth!

The entire world was awaiting this blessed Day, yet when the hidden Day was adorned and made manifest through the radiance of the Sun of Truth, all who dwell on earth remained veiled save whom God wished. Blessed are they whom the veils and allusions of the people did not prevent from the ocean of divine recognition. Arise in His Name and take the sealed wine in the name of the Self-Subsisting, may His glory be glorified, and drink it in defiance of those who denied the right of God and His loved ones and followed every heedless doubter. God willing, on this Day when the world is encompassed by the darkness of fancy and vain imaginings, thou shalt be illumined by the lights of the morn of certitude. Glory be to God! Those servants who were heedless and unaware of the origin of the Cause and its foundation are now occupied with leading souls astray. Fie upon them and upon those who follow them without any clear proof or Book! Through the grace of God, exalted be His glory, it is hoped that your honor will be engaged in the remembrance of the Purpose of the world with utmost joy and delight, and will arise to serve Him.

=== END BH06503 ===

=== START BH06504 ===

O Samandar, He is the Beloved! Jinab-i-Mirza Muhammad arrived and mentioned the ascension of the spiritual dove from the earthly ash-heap to the divine Ridvan. The utmost grief, sorrow and anguish appeared. However, since she hastened from the mortal furnace to the life-giving expanse of the immortal rose garden, and ascended from the dark hiding place to the shelter of divine favor, and flew from the earthly ash-heap to the original divine homeland, and reached from the place of limitation to the placeless realm of oneness, therefore you must cleanse and purify the tablet of your heart from grief and sorrow, and hold fast to the firm handle of the hidden divine favors. God willing, you will be nurtured under the shadow of divine generosity and drink from the cup of the hidden mercy of the Infinite Lord. And peace be upon you. And after Jinab-i-Mirza Muhammad gave a detailed account, whatever they had arranged during their lifetime to send in this direction, send it, and carry out their affairs according to the will they made. Details will be sent upon Mirza Muhammad’s return.

=== END BH06504 ===

=== START BH06505 ===

Several Most Holy and Most Exalted Tablets have been graciously bestowed upon the Afnan who are present in that land. God willing, they will attain unto them. And one Tablet has also been revealed from the heaven of divine mercy and sent especially for the son of his eminence Aqa Mirza Mu?sin, upon him be Baha’u’llah’s glory - let them deliver it. By the life of God, there hath been revealed for him on various occasions that which no eye hath seen nor mind conceived. And a Tablet hath also been revealed from the right hand of the Throne especially for his eminence Haji Siyyid Javad, upon him be Baha’u’llah’s glory. God willing, it will reach him and he will attain everlasting life through its fragrant breaths. Likewise, in response to the petition of Aqa Mirza Muhammad-Taqi, a Tablet hath been revealed - let them deliver it to him. And another Tablet for his eminence Aqa Mirza ’Abdu’l-Husayn, who was mentioned in your letter. Again regarding the matter of the two hundred tumans that must be delivered with utmost haste to the specified individual so that he may act according to what God hath desired, that is, deliver it according to the draft. Similarly, the Servant wrote acknowledging receipt of some funds and this was sent.

=== START BH06506 ===

He is God, exalted be His station of grandeur and power. O H.S., upon thee be the peace and loving-kindness of God. We testify that thou hast heard and turned thyself, and hast attained unto that which was hidden in knowledge and treasured in the hearts of them that are nigh unto God. Say: Glory be to Thee, O my God! I beseech Thee by Thy Name, the All-Subduing above all names. Glory be to Thee, O my God! I beseech Thee by Thy Name through which necks were humbled. Glory be to Thee, O my God! I beseech Thee by the penetrating power of Thy will and purpose, to ordain for me that which shall cause me in all conditions to cling fast unto Thee and hold to the hem of Thy bounty and generosity. O my Lord! Thou seest me turning unto Thee, detached from all else save Thee, acknowledging Thy oneness and assured of that which Thou hast sent down in Thy Book. I beseech Thee to make me one of those whom nothing whatsoever hath deterred from turning to the light of Thy countenance and drawing nigh unto the horizon of Thy grace. O my Lord! Aid me in that which shall cause the fragrances of Thy acceptance and good-pleasure to be diffused. Then ordain for me the good of every world of Thy worlds. Verily Thou art the All-Bountiful, the Generous. There is no God but Thee, the Forgiving, the Merciful.

=== START BH06511 ===

O Asadu’llah Beg who speaketh before all faces! Praise be to the Ancient Lord Who, with the hand of power, hath raised up the standard of “There is none other God but Him” in the most exalted station and unfurled the banner of “The Command is God’s” before the faces of all religions. Glorified be His greatness and exalted be His dominion! O Asad! Upon thee be the Glory of God, the One, the Self-Subsisting! Thy name was mentioned before the Wronged One. We have turned unto thee and revealed for thee the pearls that lay hidden in the treasuries of wisdom and utterance, that thou mayest render thanks unto thy Lord, the All-Bountiful. Say: My God, my God, my Lord and my Support! I testify that through Thee the names of divine knowledge have been adorned with the stars of utterance and the ocean of generosity hath surged before the faces of the nations. O Lord! Thou art the All-Bountiful, the Lord of great bounty. Aid us to make up for what hath escaped us in Thy days. Verily Thou art the All-Powerful, He to Whose manifestation and might all created things have testified, and to Whose grandeur and sovereignty all contingent beings have borne witness. There is none other God but Thee, the All-Bounteous, the All-Generous.

=== START BH06512 ===

In the Name of Him Who has power over what has been and what will be!

Praise befits and is worthy of the Lord of Eternity Who, by His Pen alone, has conquered the world and its peoples, and Who, severed from all acknowledgement or denial, has raised high the banner of the Chosen Name before all faces through His complete power. The clamor of the oppressors and the tumult of the aggressors did not deter Him from His purpose. Glorified be His grandeur, exalted His proof, and all-encompassing His testimony. There is no God but Him.

O Rida! Upon thee be the Glory of God, Creator of the heavens! Thou wert mentioned before the Throne, and We revealed for thee aforetime that which caused all things to soar with longing to hearken unto the call of God, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting. Rejoice in My turning toward thee from the prison, and illumine hearts with the light of thy Lord’s knowledge, and remind them of the verses of the Lord of the Unseen and the Seen. There has come before the Wronged One thy letter which thou didst send to the servant in attendance, and it was presented before His face. We have answered thee with verses whose fragrance has spread through the cities of knowledge and wisdom. Verily thy Lord is He Who has dominion over what has been and what will be.

O Rida! Convey My greetings to the loved ones on behalf of the Wronged One. Each one has attained and continues to attain to My remembrance.

The call of Eliyahu has attained to hearing. We beseech God to confirm him in steadfastness and to grant him success in that which causes the exaltation of His Word and the advancement of souls. He may say:

“My God, my God! I beseech Thee by Thy power which has conquered all created things, and by Thy might which has encompassed all existence, to assist me in that which Thou lovest and art pleased with, and to enable me to perform good deeds and display praiseworthy character. O Lord! Thou seest the seeker standing before the door of Thy grace - deprive him not of the wonders of Thy bounty and generosity. Ordain for him the good of this world and the next. Verily Thou art the Most Exalted, the Most High.”

O Rida! We now make mention of the names of those whom thou didst name in thy letter, as a grace from Us and a mercy from Our presence upon thee and them, that ye may give thanks unto your Lord, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy.

O Na’im! We bear witness that thou hast attained to Our mention, and through thy name there have appeared from the treasuries of My Most Exalted Pen the pearls of wisdom and utterance, that thou mayest thank thy Lord, the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous. Through My remembrance all things have spoken: “The Kingdom belongeth unto God, the Lord of the worlds.” There hath befallen thee and My loved ones that which hath caused the cities of God’s justice to lament, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

O Manzar! Behold, then make mention of what hath befallen Us and you in the path of God, the Lord of this wondrous Day. We have made mention of thee and My loved ones in the Crimson Tablet through My Most Exalted Pen. Give them the glad-tidings of this Word, which, when it descended from the heaven of My grace, caused all things to proclaim: “Blessed are ye, O people of Baha, and joy be unto you, O people of Sin and Dal, in that God hath given you to drink the cup of Baha from the hand of bounty, and hath mentioned you in such wise that your names shall endure through the eternality of His mighty and impregnable Kingdom.”

O Iskandar! Know thou that the Alexander whose mention the All-Merciful hath revealed in the Qur’an is none other than the Messenger Himself, though most people remain heedless. The barrier was His Word which separated the monotheists from the idolaters. Reflect upon God’s power and dominion: He hath built through the Word that which no eye hath outwardly seen, and hath prevented every remote polytheist from transgressing it. Verily, He is the Master of the two causes and the Observer of the two seas and the Mystery concealed between the two letters. Yet the people remain heedless and say that which no possessor of true insight would ever confirm.

O Sadiq! Thou wast mentioned before, and there was revealed for thee that from which every fair-minded one perceiveth the loving-kindness of thy Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. Give thanks unto thy Lord for this most great favor and say: “Praise be unto Thee, O Thou Who art the Goal of the world and the Beloved of nations, for having turned toward Thy servant when he was oppressed at the hands of the wrongdoers.”

O Muhammad-Hasan! The Lord of the world remembereth thee from the Most Great Prison with that which will draw thee nigh unto God, the Goal of them that know. Verily, there is none other God but He. He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He pleaseth. He is the Single One, the One, the Mighty, the All-Knowing.

O youth Rida! We beseech God to aid thee in that which causeth them that are nigh to perceive the fragrance of His good-pleasure. Verily, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. He disappointeth not him who turneth unto Him, nor doth He withhold from him who hath laid fast hold on His strong cord. The glory be upon thee and upon thy son. Give him the glad-tidings of My remembrance of him and of My favor which hath preceded all who are in the heavens and on earth.

O Rida! Give thou the glad-tidings of God’s loving-kindness to the souls that have been mentioned, and impart unto them that which hath been revealed, that their bodies, let alone their spirits, may soar in this holy, gentle and luminous atmosphere. Verily, We have mentioned My handmaiden and My leaf before and after. We testify that she is among those who have attained in My generous Tablet. The glory be upon thee and upon My loved ones there whose names We have not mentioned, in accordance with wisdom from Us, and I am the Powerful, the Mighty.

=== START BH06514 ===

He is the Ever-Abiding! Praise be to the Beloved Who, by His divine power, rent asunder the dense veils of contingent beings and, despite the opposition of the flies, established Himself unveiled and unhindered upon the throne of “God was, and there was nothing else besides Him.” From His right flow forth the seas of the elixir, and from His left stream the lights of loving-kindness. Blessed is he who drinketh therefrom and is numbered among the successful ones. O friends! Drink ye of the everlasting Kawthar in the days of the manifestation of the Divine Beauty, for by Him Who holdeth my soul in His hand, if ye were to search throughout all regions of the heavens and earth during the time of His absence, ye would not attain unto a single drop thereof. The Ancient Beauty declareth: The mysteries of this Revelation remain concealed, and were they to be revealed, verily would the people of the earth be struck with terror, save him whose heart God hath purified with this Kawthar. O people of the Bayan! The banners of the Revelation have been raised in the name of the All-Merciful, and the pavilion of the Cause hath been pitched at the midmost heart of contingent being, and the most exalted Tasnim is being passed round by the immortal youths. Take ye and drink, O people of holiness, in this glorious paradise, and be not of them that delay!

=== END BH06514 ===

=== START BH06516 ===

He is God, exalted be His glory, the Forgiving, the All-Bountiful!

All praise that transcends the comprehension of the peoples of the contingent world befitteth the Purpose of all worlds, Who hath illumined the universe with the lights of His Most Great Name. He is the King Whose absolute and penetrating Will suffereth no change or impediment from the praise or blame of the nations. In the midst of sorrows and tribulations, the Supreme Pen uttereth mention of His loved ones. Glorified be His majesty, exalted be His power, and there is no God but Him.

The letter thou didst send to his honor Aqa Siyyid Taqi, upon him be the Glory of God, reached this Prisoner. Praise be to God, from it wafted the sweet fragrances of divine love and the gentle breezes of heavenly grace. Blessed is the heart that hath turned to the Most Sublime Horizon, and the face that hath directed itself toward God, the Lord of all beings, and the pen that hath moved in His remembrance and the remembrance of His loved ones, and the tongue that hath uttered His praise. As commanded by the Most Holy, Most Exalted Decree, it was presented in its entirety before His presence, and these sublime utterances and resplendent words were revealed from the heaven of expression of the Lord of all possibility. His word - exalted be His utterance, magnificent His proof, and mighty His sovereignty:

In My Name, the Wronged One, the Stranger

O people of Manshad! Upon you be the Glory of God, His grace, the mercy of God and His peace. Verily the Kingdom of Utterance hath turned toward you and made mention of you in such wise that all mention in the world hath bowed low at its revelation, that ye might rejoice and be numbered among the thankful. His honor Diya, one of My Branches, hath presented your letter and made mention of you before Our presence. We have answered you with that which hath caused rivers of wisdom and utterance to flow from the impenetrable rock, as a bounty from the presence of the All-Merciful. Verily, He is the All-Bountiful, the Most Generous. Let not the oppression of the oppressors and the assault of the deniers sadden you. Take what hath flowed from My Most Exalted Pen, then recite it morn and eve, in spite of those who denied after having professed their belief, and disbelieved after having believed in God, the Lord of all worlds. By My life! There hath been sent down for you that from which the fragrance of mercy from God, the Mighty, the Great, shall never be cut off. God shall soon seize those who have wronged, and raise up His loved ones through His Name amongst His servants. Verily, He is the Protector of those who profess His unity, who have not broken God’s Covenant and have taken hold of His Book with such strength as hath frustrated all the powers of the world. Blessed is he who hath heard and attained, and woe unto the heedless.

In these days Haifa hath become the seat of the throne of thy Lord, and his honor Siyyid Taqi, upon him be the Glory of God, hath risen to serve with divine assistance. We beseech God, blessed and exalted be He, to confirm him in the Greater Steadfastness in this Mighty Announcement. And We have revealed from the heaven of Our utterance, for those who were martyred in Ya, that which hath enraptured the hearts of those near unto God. Glorified be God! The oppressors of that land have committed that which hath caused wailing and lamentation to be raised from the Most Exalted Paradise and the Supreme Heaven, imagining they would profit from this trade. However, the Most Exalted Pen beareth witness to the loss of these heedless and evil souls. Soon shall they behold the recompense of their deeds - a promise from God, the Ordainer, the All-Wise. And specifically regarding the martyrs, there hath flowed from the Tongue of Grandeur that which is eternally preserved in the Crimson Tablet, meaning it shall remain and endure. We testify that they have attained unto that which none before them have attained, save whom God, the Lord of all worlds, hath willed.

O people of Minshad! That which hath caused all things to lament and the tears of them that know to flow hath befallen you in the path of God. We testify that ye are among the horsemen in the arena of the love of God, who have outstripped all that are in the heavens and the earth. We convey Our greetings and salutations to all the loved ones in that land - salutations whose fragrance shall endure throughout the duration of God’s earthly and heavenly kingdoms and shall be diffused amongst His servants. Blessed are ye and blessed are the patient ones among you. Their reward is assuredly with the Mighty, the Trustworthy.

The breezes of the utterance of the Desired One of the worlds and the fragrances of His verses have been diffused in such wise that the Pen of creation is powerless and incapable to describe them. This Prisoner beseecheth the True One, exalted be His glory, to make the loved ones aware of that which hath been ordained for them from the Most Exalted Pen. Ere long shall they who possess insight behold the oppressors of the earth in manifest loss and grievous torment. He is the Just One Who hath pledged that He will not overlook the tyranny of the oppressors. We testify that He will fulfill His promise and make manifest that which the Pen hath uttered in the arena of the Tablet. Our Lord is, verily, the Almighty, the Powerful.

In the letter mention was made of the sons of Mirza Ibrahim, upon them be the glory of God and His loving-kindness. After it was presented before the presence of the Lord of all beings, these clear and decisive verses were sent down from the heaven of the favor of the Lord of Names and Attributes:

In My Name, the One Who speaketh before all faces!

O sons of him who was named Ibrahim! Hearken unto the call that hath been raised from Haifa, the seat of the throne of command. Verily, it transformeth fear into tranquility, sorrow into joy, poverty into wealth, and turning away into drawing nigh. Thus hath the Tongue of Grandeur spoken from this glorious station. Today the treachery in the eyes of the oppressors and that which is hidden in the breasts of the idolaters hath become manifest and visible. The loved ones of this Most Great Revelation are as touchstones for the peoples. Wickedness and immorality have exposed the rejected and tyrannical souls. He is the Mighty One Whom the power of the world cannot weaken, and the determinations of creation cannot prevent His irrevocable decree from being enforced. Whatsoever hath befallen this wronged people at the hands of the oppressors shall assuredly be followed by their punishment and the recompense of the loved ones shall become as manifest as the sun in the world. Blessed are they that draw nigh and woe unto the oppressors.

It is hoped that the souls mentioned will arise to serve the Cause with perfect steadfastness and firm certitude, with wisdom and utterance. In all circumstances hold fast unto wisdom. This is what ye have been commanded in the Tablet and in My perspicuous Book. Praise be to God, the Lord of the worlds.

The raindrops of His mercy are beyond reckoning and the fruits of the Tree of His grace surpass counting. This Prisoner beseecheth the True One, exalted be His glory, on behalf of himself and the loved ones and friends, for assistance to hold fast unto such deeds as will cause the Word to be exalted and His loved ones to ascend. Were the people of the earth to meditate for but an hour on that which hath been revealed and sent down, they would turn unto Him, detached from all else save Him. He is the Dawning-Place of loving-kindness and the Day-Spring of mercy. All are poor before the manifestation of His grace and weak before the evidences of His power. The Prisoner declareth:

O my God, my God! Thou seest me ablaze with the fire of Thy love and thankful for the manifestations of Thy bounty. I beseech Thee by the mysteries treasured within the repository of Thy knowledge and the pearls concealed within the shells of the ocean of Thy bounty to aid me and Thy servants to diffuse Thy verses among Thy creatures. Verily, Thou art the All-Powerful, the Most Generous, and within Thy grasp are the keys of glory and authority.

Concerning what you mentioned about Jinab-i-Aqa Husayn Haji-Rajab and also Jinab-i-Aqa Siyyid, as was said before, many were beheaded. Praise be to God, the lovers in the city of detachment all attained in the path of God to that which had been the ultimate hope of those near unto Him and the sincere ones. I beseech God to grant true vision to the people of the world, that all may become aware of the loftiness, exaltation, glory and majesty of His chosen ones, and likewise become cognizant of their own abasement, darkness, wickedness and presumption. How many souls ran through mountains and suffered in waterless, barren deserts for this Cause! By the life of God, all that befell the martyrs and chosen ones hath been recorded by the Supreme Pen in the Book of Recompense. Verily our Lord is the Just, the Wise.

After these matters were presented before the presence of the Lord of Names and Attributes, these effulgent words and manifest verses were revealed:

He is the All-Knowing, the Wise

O My loved ones! In these days ye made mention of the martyrs, upon them be the splendor of God, the splendor of the Most Exalted Paradise, the Supreme Heaven, and the splendor of the people of Baha by whose light were illumined the worlds which none hath known save God. Be not grieved by what hath come to pass. That which hath been revealed concerning the martyrs and chosen ones is such that the agencies of the heavens and earth cannot equal it. We testify that they took the cup of utterance and drank therefrom in the name of God, the Speaking, the Present, the Manifest, the Trustworthy. Nothing whatsoever escapeth His knowledge. He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He pleaseth.

We wish to make mention of Haji Husayn who attained the presence of God and drank the choice wine of revelation from the hands of bounty. We testify that he attained unto that which was inscribed in the Books of God, the Lord of Lords. His remembrance hath ever been and will continue to be in the presence of the Wronged One.

O people of Minshad! Time and again hath Jinab-i-Siyyid Taqi – upon him be My Baha and My loving-kindness – made mention of you, and hath attained Our presence on your behalf, and his deeds have been adorned with the ornament of acceptance. Give thanks unto God, the Lord of the mighty Throne and the exalted Seat. O people of Minshad! Hearken unto the call of the Wronged One, and hold fast unto that which conduceth to the recognition and orientation of the servants.

O Lord! Make things easy, not difficult. O my God, my Lord! Thy servant Diya hath raised the hands of supplication toward the heaven of Thy generosity, and seeketh from the clouds of Thy mercy that which will adorn the saplings of existence with blessed and sublime fruits. I convey greetings, glorification and light to the loved ones of that land, and from the gate of mercy I beseech for each one that which is sanctified above all peer and likeness. Verily our Lord is the Compassionate, the All-Bountiful. There is no God but He, the Self-Sufficient, the Most Exalted.

Glory and remembrance and praise be upon thee, O Ismail, and upon those who have believed in God, the One, the All-Informed.

Diya

16th of Safar 1209 [?]

=== START BH06518 ===

In the Name of God, the Powerful, the Mighty

At that moment there came from the direction of the Most Exalted Paradise a breeze from which I detected the fragrance of the Beloved, and through it I came to know what none in the worlds had known, and I found what none among the mystics had found. And I felt it stirring around my right ear as though it had come with glad tidings from God, the King, the Mighty, the Beautiful. When I turned my ear toward it, by God, it gave me such joyous tidings that I could not remain still within myself. I trembled, and everything that had been created between the heavens and the earth trembled with me. And for this reason I nearly forgot what We intended to mention in this exalted Tablet. O servant! Give thanks unto God, thy Lord, for having been mentioned at this time wherein all things and all who dwell in the kingdom of the Command have rejoiced. We beseech God to assist thee in His Cause, to rain down mercy upon thee from His presence, and to grant thee a seat of truth with His near servants. And glory be upon thee and upon those who have desired the countenance of the Youth and have attained unto this Most Great, this mighty Command.

=== START BH06520 ===

He is God! During this period, certain matters have caused delay in the manifestation of this Cause, as mentioned in previous Tablets. What was destined has come to pass, and this is among His most wondrous and hidden wisdom. However, the companions of God and His loved ones must in all circumstances remain tranquil in the tranquility of Truth, and with utmost assurance walk between manifestation and concealment. And these very trials and tribulations that have befallen this servant from the year sixty until now, which is eighty, are sufficient reminder for all souls. By God, any being who desires to ascend to the supreme companion and soar to the highest horizons of eternity must surely walk in the footsteps of these servants, so that in all worlds they may fly and move in harmony with the birds of the divine throne. And he who has known God will know none else besides Him and will forget all else save Him. In any case, with perfect joy, delight and gladness, let them be reminded of God’s wondrous remembrances. And the Spirit be upon you and upon those who are patient in this great terror.

=== END BH06520 ===

=== START BH06521 ===

He is the Most Exalted, the Most High

In the Holy Books of God, mention was made of the Day of Manifestation, and all peoples awaited that Day. Yet when the Dawning-Place of divine commandments and the Manifestation of God’s revelation illumined the world’s horizons, the people remained deprived of the light of nearness and reunion, save those souls who detached themselves from the world and all who dwell therein and turned their faces toward the All-Merciful. Faith in God was not and is not mere claims - this is why He tested all through the touchstone of the Most Great Name’s appearance, that the righteous might be distinguished from the wicked and the pure-hearted from the evil-doers. How lofty is the station of that soul who was not kept back from the Lord of Names and Attributes by the veils and allusions of the peoples of the earth, and who held fast to God’s straight path. Thou must render thanks in all conditions to the Object of all creation, Who enabled thee to succeed and guided thee to the clear path. His mercy hath preceded all created things and His grace hath encompassed the worlds. God willing, mayest thou speak with the utmost joy and delight in praise of the one true God and fix thy gaze upon the horizon of His loving-kindness.

=== END BH06521 ===

=== START BH06522 ===

O handmaid of God, Sadr-Jahan, upon her be the Glory of God! In the name of the one incomparable Lord! The ocean of divine utterance in this hour is manifest with the waves of mercy, and the sun of proof has risen from the horizon of the Most Glorious Tablet. Glory be to God! The proofs of the world bow down in prostration while the servants remain heedless. All things are engaged in glorification and praise, yet the people remain deprived. O my leaf! O my handmaid! Praise be to the Goal of the world Who confirmed thee in recognizing the Dawning-Place of Revelation in days when the peoples of the world were deprived, save whom thy Lord willed. We beseech God that He may confirm thee in such wise that thou mayest become the cause of sanctification and detachment of the handmaids of this age. This is not difficult for God. How many handmaids who had no mention among the servants, yet afterwards through divine grace and heavenly bounty, their remembrance adorned the pages of books. Blessed are they and joy be unto them! The intellect is a great instrument and a truthful messenger from God - it conveys both good and evil. Blessed is he who attaineth unto that which God hath desired in the Book. The Glory be upon thee and upon those who are with thee.

=== END BH06522 ===

=== START BH06523 ===

O handmaid of God! One of the branches hath ascended. In the name of the loving Lord - the ocean of bounty is surging and the sun of grace is manifest and evident, yet most of humanity hath not seen or comprehended. The promised Herald calleth out and raiseth His voice between earth and heaven, yet the servants are not drawn to hearken, save whom God willeth. The ophthalmia of vain imaginings hath prevented the eye from beholding, and the cotton of idle fancies hath stopped the ear from hearing. O handmaid of God! This bounty sufficeth thee - that while the divines of Iran who for long years and successive centuries deemed themselves the most exalted, most great, most pious, most noble and most learned, failed to recognize the Sun of Manifestation, thou hast attained unto its recognition. Know thou this mighty blessing and guard it in the name of God from thieves and robbers. Many pure and goodly deeds were destroyed by the fire of disobedience, and many radiant faces were darkened by the smoke of waywardness. Hold fast to the cord of thy Lord’s grace and cling to the hem of His Generous Name.

=== START BH06524 ===

He is God, exalted be His glory, the All-Wise, the All-Eloquent

The mention of the All-Merciful from the Lote-Tree of Utterance in the heart of Paradise hath verily been raised up in truth. This is a Day wherein the earth hath shone with the light of its Lord and hath related its tidings, and God was, in truth, the Witness and the All-Knowing thereof. I beseech Thee by Thy most great signs, and by the breathings of Thy Revelation, and by the manifestations of Thy power and might, to ordain for me, through Thy grace and bounty, that which will draw me nigh unto Thee in all conditions. Verily, Thou art the All-Possessing, the Most High. There is none other God but Thee, the Mighty, the All-Bountiful.

=== START BH06526 ===

In the Name of God, the Most Mighty, the Most Glorious!

The remembrance of God is a leaf among His leaves, and verily His remembrance hath preceded all worlds. Were it not for His remembrance, none would have known Him to remember Him. Thus hath the matter been decreed, but the people are in a mighty veil. And verily His remembrance hath appeared in the temple of the Youth. Blessed be God, the Best of creators! He verily remembereth the servants through the remembrance of God, the Exalted, the Great.

O handmaiden of God! Rejoice within thyself that the Pen of this Great Remembrance hath moved to make mention of thee. Beware lest thou grieve over anything, for the world shall pass away and sovereignty shall remain with thy Lord, the Mighty, the Praised. He exalteth whom He willeth and abaseth whom He willeth. Within His grasp lies the dominion of the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He, verily, is powerful over all things. He doeth what He pleaseth and ordaineth what He willeth. His is the Command and the Creation, before and after. All are His servants and all are among those who bow down before His countenance.

And glory be upon thee and upon the steadfast handmaidens and steadfast servants.

=== START BH06527 ===

The True One hath appeared in the Kingdom of verses and hath called out to all, guiding them to the highest horizon. However, the divines of Iran have forbidden the people from turning towards it, and have issued the decree for the shedding of the pure blood of the Lord of mankind. In every land the croaking is raised and shall continue to be raised. Blessed are they whom neither the world nor the nations have prevented from the Straight Path. The handmaiden of God, wife of J, upon him be the Most Ancient, Most Great Glory of God - mention was made of thee in the Most Holy Presence. Therefore this most impregnable Tablet hath been revealed from the Supreme Pen especially for that handmaiden of God and is being sent, that thou mayest be assured of His favor and stand firm in His Cause. Beseech God - exalted be His glory - at all times that He may grant thee success to remain not veiled by the world and whatsoever is therein from His recognition. With heart and soul remain steadfast in His love and engaged in His remembrance. The ocean of bounty is surging - blessed are they that advance! The chalice of mercy is overflowing - joy and happiness to them that drink! The effulgences of the lights of His countenance are manifest and visible - blessed are they that attain! Strive thou that through the favors of the Friend thou mayest become detached and freed from all else but Him and mayest gaze with thy entire being toward the Most Great Scene. With complete resolve and utter helplessness, beseech the Sovereign Who doeth what He willeth that He deprive not any from the Kawthar of His knowledge. He is powerful over all things. He is verily the Powerful, the Forgiving, the Generous.

He is the Most Holy, the Most Great, the Most Exalted

Your mention hath reached the Wronged One in the Most Great Prison, and from the Most Sublime Horizon and the Most Exalted Pen these words have been revealed, that they may be unto thee a glory, an honor and a treasure with God, the Lord of all worlds. O my Lord! I am he who hath sought the heaven of Thy grace and the ocean of Thy good-pleasure. Verily Thou art the Lord of all creation and the Sovereign of the throne on high and of the dust beneath. There is none other God but Thee, the Mighty, the All-Conquering, the All-Powerful.

=== START BH06550 ===

Muhammad-?ahir

In the Name of God, the Most Holy, the Most Ancient

This is an admonition unto him who hath turned unto Our countenance, and directed himself towards the Point of Adoration of all who are in heaven and on earth, that he may hearken, with the ear of his heart, unto the call of God, and arise to serve the Cause in both the morning and the night-season.

Blessed art thou, inasmuch as the countenance of thy Lord hath turned towards thee from these precincts, which God hath appointed the source of illumination unto all lands. Be thou steadfast in thy love for Him Who is thy Lord, and be not of those who, when the winds of trial pass over them, rise up in protest, and oppose themselves unto God, the Lord of all religions.

Arise thou in such wise that thou shalt not be swayed by the whisperings of the people, nor perturbed by the idle fancies of those who speak as prompted by their own desires, notwithstanding that thy Lord, the Almighty, the All-Knowing, doth Himself attest unto their ignorance. Beware lest thou be dismayed by all that chanceth on earth. Remain thou steadfast in that which hath been enjoined upon thee by thy Lord, the Almighty, the All-Compelling.

What is the meaning of “sha’n” here? (Consensus on present rendering.)

We, truly, have sent down on every matter that which shall impart tranquillity unto the minds of the God-fearing. Blessed are those that read the verses of Our Revelation, and discover from them that which hath been purposed by their Lord, Who ordaineth whatsoever He desireth. Thus have We sent down the verses, and despatched them unto thee, that thou mayest yield thanks unto the Lord thy God, unto Whose command the winds are subject.

=== START BH06551 ===

O Nabil-i-Ardikani, who went and returned by the command of his Most Ancient Lord! This is a remembrance unto him who was mentioned before the Throne, that he may arise to serve his Lord with the power of his All-Knowing, All-Wise Lord. O servant! Thy Lord hath borne all the tribulations of the earth to manifest the Cause of thy Lord, the Almighty, the Omnipotent, that all may recognize the Lord of the worlds. Among the people are those who have denied the signs and proofs of God, and among them are those who have turned to God, the Mighty, the Praiseworthy. Verily, he who hath turned unto Him is extolled by those in the Kingdom of Command, while he who hath turned away is cursed by the denizens of the realm of Might and those who circle round His glorious Throne. Give thanks unto God for having attained unto My days and for having recognized that which most of the servants have failed to recognize. This is naught but a manifest grace. Sorrows have encompassed Us in these days to such an extent that none can reckon them save the All-Knowing One. In such a state We have left them and commit all unto God, the Mighty, the Bountiful. It behooveth him who hath believed in God to follow his Lord in this wise Cause in such wise that neither the prevention of any preventer nor the turning away of those who have disbelieved in God, the Lord of the exalted Throne, shall hinder him.

=== START BH06552 ===

In the Name of the Mighty, the All-Bestowing! A remembrance unto him who hath turned unto My Kingdom, heard My call and responded thereunto through My grace, and I am verily the Answerer. When We sent down the verses and revealed the clear proofs, there arose against Us one who had been concealed behind a thick veil. He came forth saying “I am your Lord, the Most High.” We said: “Perdition unto thee, O thou who associateth partners with God and art far removed from Him!” We have counseled all in the Book with that which profiteth them, yet We have found the people to be heedless, save whom thy Lord willeth, the Mighty, the Powerful, the Praiseworthy. O Khalil, who hath emigrated and attained unto the name of the Peerless Beloved! The men and heroes of the world are seen to be heedless of God, although they were created for this Day. Whosoever hath ascended by the ladder of utterance to the kingdom of meanings, he is the knight of this field and he is the hero of this arena. === START BH06554 ===

In the Name of God, the Compassionate!

The spirit of all deeds is the good-pleasure of God, for if one should perform all good deeds, yet from them the fragrance of God’s good-pleasure be not inhaled, those deeds will yield neither fruit nor effect nor result. None shall attain unto this most great bounty save through praiseworthy character and goodly deeds, for these matters are the cause of the order of the world and the preservation of nations and will conduce to the exaltation of the Word of God. Therefore it is incumbent upon all to remind heedless souls, with utmost kindness and compassion, of that which will profit them, that all may be immersed in the ocean of God’s good-pleasure. Your honor must strive with the utmost diligence to refine souls and promote unity and concord. Every service rendered today for the sake of God will endure and remain forever. We make mention of thee from Our Most Great Prison that thou mayest remind the people of this Day the like of which hath not appeared in creation. The Glory be upon thee and upon whomsoever hath turned unto God, the Lord of all mankind.

=== START BH06555 ===

In the Name of the peerless Lord, the Cupbearer of the wine of immortality, the Lord of Names! Blessed is the soul that, in the days of the Lord of Power, hath quaffed the most pure wine and hath attained unto the ocean of the knowledge of the Lord of Religions. Today is the day of teaching, and all are commanded to it, that the sincere ones may attain unto the station that hath been revealed in the Book of God: “Whoso quickeneth a soul is as though he had quickened all mankind.” The life that is mentioned in God’s Book is the life of hearts and minds through the knowledge of the Beloved. If anyone faileth to attain unto this station, he is accounted among the dead. Therefore must the friends of God strive mightily, night and day, that perchance they may guide those who have gone astray unto the straight path, and give the thirsty to drink of this living water. Whosoever attaineth unto this station is accounted among the gems of existence in the sight of God. Be not grieved at the taunts of the enemies and the power of the hateful ones. Soon shall the former be turned into praise and glory, and the latter into weakness and extinction. Blessed are ye, O My loved ones! A goodly end awaiteth you.

=== START BH06556 ===

He is the One Who calls from His most exalted horizon

The veils of glory did not prevent the scratching of the Most Exalted Pen, and the veils of the people of error did not hold Him back from His purpose. Before all faces, without any screen or veil, He spoke that which would reform the world and refine the nations. From the beginning of days until now He has been afflicted in the hands of enemies - at times imprisoned, at times transferred like a captive from land to land. But tribulations in the path of the Goal of all worlds have been and are beloved. The lovers in all regions know the value of this station. In the nights and days We have summoned the servants to that which would cause the elevation of the Word and the advancement of souls. Yet most were found heedless, nay, turned away. We beseech God that He may confirm you and grant you the greatest steadfastness, that you may remain protected from the doubts of the people and the events of the days. Blessed art thou for having heard and turned, and blessed is he who has attained unto this Most Great Announcement in the days of God, the Lord of the worlds.

=== START BH06557 ===

He is the One with power over all who are on earth and in heaven!

Glorified is He Who has manifested Himself to all in the world and caused Him to speak that which is inscribed in a preserved tablet. Verily this is the Most Great Book among the nations and His path for all who are in the heavens and earths. Verily it is the Preserved Tablet and the Sealed Book, yet most people are heedless. Through it has appeared what was hidden and come forth what was intended in God’s knowledge, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. Through it has crowed the Cock of the Throne and warbled the Dove: “There is no God but I, the Forgiving, the Generous.”

Your name was mentioned before the One Who is Mentioned and this Clear Tablet was revealed for you, that you may arise to help the Cause of God in such manner that the power of the oppressors will not weaken you. Know that the world will perish and all that pertains to it will change. Leave it behind you, holding fast to that which you were commanded by your Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. Thus have We remembered you in the Most Great Prison when the Ancient Beauty was in the hands of the heedless ones. This is from His favor upon you - therefore praise and say: “Praise be to Thee, O Lord of the worlds!”

=== START BH06573 ===

He is God, exalted be His station, the Grandeur and the Power

Glorified art Thou, O my God, O Lord of existence and Knower of the mysteries of the unseen and the seen! Then inscribe their names in Thy Book and ordain for them that which shall endure as long as Thy celestial and heavenly dominion shall endure. O Lord! Thou seest the one who hath turned toward Thee. I beseech Thee by Thy Prophets and Thy Messengers to forgive him and those who have believed in Thee and in Thy signs, and to accept from him what he hath wrought in Thy path. Verily Thou art the Almighty, the Most Exalted, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed. There is no God but Thee, the Single One, the All-Wise.

Praise be unto Thee, O God of the worlds!

=== START BH06576 ===

V

Lauded be Thy name, O my God! Thou beholdest me in the clutches of my oppressors. Every time I turn to my right, I hear the voice of the lamentation of them that are dear to Thee, whom the infidels have made captives for having believed in Thee and in Thy signs, and for having set their faces towards the horizon of Thy grace and of Thy loving-kindness. And when I turn to my left, I hear the clamor of the wicked doers who have disbelieved in Thee and in Thy signs, and persistently striven to put out the light of Thy lamp which sheddeth the radiance of Thine own Self over all that are in Thy heaven and all that are on Thy earth.

The hearts of Thy chosen ones, O my Lord, have melted because of their separation from Thee, and the souls of Thy loved ones are burnt up by the fire of their yearning after Thee in Thy days. I implore Thee, O Thou Maker of the heavens and Lord of all names, by Thy most effulgent Self and Thy most exalted and all-glorious Remembrance, to send down upon Thy loved ones that which will draw them nearer unto Thee, and enable them to hearken unto Thine utterances.

Tear asunder with the hand of Thy transcendent power, O my Lord, the veil of vain imaginings, that they who are wholly devoted to Thee may see Thee seated on the throne of Thy majesty, and the eyes of such as adore Thy unity may rejoice at the splendors of the glory of Thy face. The doors of hope have been shut against the hearts that long for Thee, O my Lord! Their keys are in Thy hands; open them by the power of Thy might and Thy sovereignty. Potent art Thou to do as Thou pleasest. Thou art, verily, the Almighty, the Beneficent.

=== START BH06577 ===

In the Name of God, the Most Powerful, the Most Powerful!

Glorified art Thou, O my God! Thou seest Thy servants imprisoned among Thy creatures, deprived of beholding Thy countenance and visiting Thy presence, bound by the shackles of hatred through what the hands of the transgressors among Thy creation have wrought, and chained in Thy path. Should anyone say that Thou hast withdrawn from them the glance of Thy loving-kindness, all things would deny this, for I observe that Thou art watching over them, and that Thy forbearance with the idolaters is due only to a wisdom which Thou hast concealed from the eyes of Thy servants. Soon wilt Thou raise up those who have fallen in Thy love, and exalt those who have been abased in Thy path, and illumine the faces of those who have been disfigured by the blows of the polytheists for Thy Cause. Thou hast ordained days wherein each one of Thy loved ones shall be raised up through the manifestations of Thy power and the revelations of Thy glory. Such pure ones, who have tasted the edge of swords in their longing for Thy beauty and have drunk poison in their search for Thy presence, are worthy of Thy praise, O Thou Who art the Beloved of Baha! Thou seest Thy Beloved in the prison of ’Akka, desiring not His own ease but Thy good-pleasure and Thy will. There is no God but Thee, the One extolled by the tongue of Baha in the highest heaven and on earth. Verily, Thou art the Beloved of the worlds.

In the Name of God, the Most Bountiful, the Most Bountiful!

Though I knew it not, I beseech Thee by it, as I know it hath appeared from Thy Most Exalted Word, that Thou wilt not withhold me for less than the twinkling of an eye from the knowledge of Thyself and the wondrous manifestations of the glory of Thy Lordship and the signs of Thy Divine Unity. Leave me not among those of Thy creation who associate partners with Thee and who oppose Thee. He is the Most Great, the Most Ancient, the Most Glorious

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him. He hath ever been, and will ever be, even as He hath been. He is the Single, the One, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise. O people of the earth! Be fair in your judgment, by God, and transgress not against Him Who hath come to you from the Dayspring of His Cause with manifest sovereignty. He desireth for you naught save the mercy and bounty of God. Be fair in your judgment and be not of the wrongdoers. Consider ye and call to mind the generations of old. Where are they who pronounced judgment against Muhammad, the Apostle of God? Where are they who clung to idols, turning away from God, the Lord of all men? Where are they who opposed the Spirit? Where are they who pronounced judgment against God’s chosen ones and His messengers without clear proof or explicit Book? Thus have We sent down the verses and dispatched them unto thee that thou mayest remind the people of this Cause which lay hidden in God’s knowledge and was mentioned in the Books of the Messengers. The manifest remembrance from the Most Great Book be upon thee and upon those who cast away idols, clinging to the hem of their Lord’s grace, the Almighty, the All-Powerful.

=== START BH06597 ===

He is the Manifest, the Speaking, the All-Knowing

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him, and that He Who hath come is indeed the One promised by My tongue, recorded by My pen, remembered in My heart, and made manifest in My days - days wherewith We gave glad tidings unto all in My Books, My Scriptures, My Psalms and My Preserved Tablet.

God willing, mayest thou in all conditions fix thy gaze upon the Most Exalted Horizon and hold fast to the firm cord. Today, whosoever hath attained unto the recognition of God, exalted be His glory, is recorded and inscribed in the Book of God as the most distinguished among the servants of the past and future. Blessed is he who hath attained unto this supreme station. However, this station is perfected through complete and perfect steadfastness. The beginning is the knowledge of God and its end is steadfastness in His love and in that assistance which, in the divine Books, referreth to the teaching of His Cause. This must be done with perfect wisdom and moderation, lest any matter arise that would cause disturbance and unrest among souls. The glory be upon thee and upon those who have attained unto the days of their Lord and acted according to that which they were commanded in His perspicuous Book.

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him, and that He Who hath come is the Lamp of Guidance among creatures, the Most Great Sign unto all peoples, the Dawning-Place of the Cause amidst humanity, and the Manifestation of Bounty to all who are in the heavens and on earth. O servants of the All-Merciful in all lands! Hearken unto the Call from the Most Exalted Horizon. He counseleth you with that which draweth you nigh unto God, the Lord of all worlds - with trustworthiness, religious devotion, chastity and fidelity, and with that through which the essence of justice may be made manifest in the contingent world. Grieve thou not over anything. Dominion belongeth unto God, the One, the Almighty, the Glorious, the All-Bountiful.

He is the Dawning Place from the Horizon of Power

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him and that He Who speaketh the truth is indeed He through Whom the Books were sent down and the Scriptures were revealed and every wise command made manifest. How many servants have read the Books of God and His Scriptures, yet when their Revealer appeared they denied Him - these are accounted among the most lost in a clear Book. We have heard thy call and witnessed thy turning unto Us. We have turned toward thee and remembered thee with that which shall endure throughout the eternity of My most excellent Names. === START BH06604 ===

He is the All-Witnessing, the All-Informed

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him, and He Who speaketh upon the throne when it was upon the water is verily the Hidden Mystery which none hath known save whom God, the Most High, the Most Great, hath willed. He hath come with a power that the might of the powerful could not weaken, and with a sovereignty that the hosts of those who turned away from the Countenance and denied this Revelation, wherewith the Books of God, the Lord of all worlds, had given glad tidings, could not frighten. We have heard thy call and answered thee, and have remembered thee with a remembrance that the ornaments of the world and whatsoever is with the nations cannot equal. To this beareth witness every discerning knower. Take thou the Kawthar of steadfastness in the name of thy Lord, then drink with His All-Wise remembrance. He is the Most Holy, the Most Unapproachable, the Most Great

=== START BH06606 ===

The Most Holy, the Most Great. God testifies that there is none other God but He. He sends down from the heaven of grace whatsoever He willeth and desireth. He is, in truth, the Revealer, the All-Wise.

The holy Kingdom hath been adorned with the Most Holy Book. Blessed is he who holdeth fast unto it, and woe betide the heedless. He who acteth in accordance with that which hath been revealed therein is truly of the people of Baha in this wondrous Tablet.

Beware lest the might of the powerful sadden you or the insinuations of the wayward keep you back. Take fast hold of the Most Great Cord, then remember the Lord of all worlds.

The dwellers of the Kingdom of eternity have been seized with rapture, and the grace of God hath encompassed both small and great. Blessed is the seeker who hath desired the Desired One, and the pursuer who hath recognized the Adored One, and the soul that hath arisen to serve the Cause of God, the Lord of the worlds.

We make mention of all who have turned to the Countenance and We inscribe their names in Our preserved Tablet. Can any bounty equal this? Nay, by the Creator of the heavens and earth!

We have revealed the Book and have enjoined all therein with supreme wisdom, lest that appear which would trouble the hearts of the servants. He is, in truth, the All-Forgiving, the All-Bountiful.

Thus have We remembered thee and favored thee with this wondrous Tablet.

Among the people are those who have turned away from God and spoken that which caused eyes to shed tears. He is among those whom vain imaginings have prevented from turning to God, Lord of Might. To this testifies the preserved Book in His possession, which was inscribed by the Finger of Power and wherein every hidden matter is recorded. Say: Observe then judge fairly. The One Who came with the Kingdom of verses - against Him have the people risen up, while he who cannot speak in the presence of His countenance is deemed the Beloved. The decree in the Qur’an has been fulfilled: “Every sect rejoices in what it possesses.” We have remembered and called out to you from the prison, that you might give thanks to your Lord, the Kind One.

=== START BH06609 ===

The Wronged One beareth witness unto that which the Books of God have witnessed before and after. Blessed are they who know. O thou who speaketh in My Name! Say: O people of the earth! Say: Be fair, O people, and follow not those who have denied God, the Lord of all names. Behold what hath appeared in truth, then be fair, and be not of those who said “God is our Lord,” but when He came from the horizon of might they said “This is naught but a lying impostor.” The trumpet hath been sounded in truth, yet the people are in doubt and strife. Say: Look ye, look ye, for the Sun hath risen from the horizon of proof. Hearken ye, hearken ye, for the Call hath been raised from all religions. Thus hath the ocean of utterance surged from the Pen of the All-Merciful. === START BH06610 ===

He is the Speaker from the Most Exalted Summit

God testifieth that there is none other God but Him. His are the Command and Creation. He giveth life and causeth death, and He is the Ever-Living Who dieth not. Within His grasp lieth the Kingdom of Command and Creation, and in His right hand the reins of all created things. Nothing moveth save by His command. He doeth what He willeth and ordaineth what He pleaseth. He is the Single One, the One, the Mighty, the All-Praised.

The ornaments of the world have occupied the peoples and kept them back from the recognition of God, exalted be His glory. By ornaments is meant at times the love of the world, and at other times its trappings and adornments, and in one station all that preventeth men from drawing nigh unto God. However, in the highest degree and the first station, it is the divines of Persia who have prevented the hapless souls from the Truth. These are the veils and barriers. Beseech God that He may adorn them with the ornament of justice and fairness, that all may attain unto that which is the cause of salvation. Say: Today the gate of grace is opened wide - strive ye that ye may not remain deprived. Verily your Lord, the All-Merciful, is the Forgiving, the Compassionate.

=== START BH06611 ===

O Aqa Jan, upon him be the Glory of God! In the name of the Peerless Beloved! Your cry and lamentation were heard and the flame of your love was observed. Wherever you were, the Friend was with you, and whatsoever befell you was recorded in the Book of the Lord of Names by the Supreme Pen. By My life! You were under the gaze of your Lord. Verily, He heareth and seeth, and He is the All-Seeing Witness. Reflect upon the heedlessness of the people, who all utter the words “May God hasten His coming,” yet not a single soul hath understood what this allusion signifieth and whence it shall appear, though all were beseeching the Ancient Truth for His manifestation. Praise be to the Goal of the world that thou hast recognized that which the divines and mystics of the earth are veiled from. They have pronounced judgment against Him Whom they invoke night and day. Such is the condition of heedless souls. Soon shall they find themselves in grief and remorse, while they shall behold thee radiant from the horizon of thy Lord’s tender mercy. This remembrance from this wondrous Pen sufficeth thee, from thy Lord, the Mighty, the Inaccessible.

=== START BH06614 ===

Nusratabad Sirjan, His honor Siyyid Muhammad

He is the Ruler over whatsoever He willeth

Blessed is he who hath arisen detached from the world and turned towards God, the Protector, the Self-Subsisting. How many a servant hath been deprived of the Most Great Bounty, and how many a servant hath attained unto this destined Remembrance! Say: The bounty is His manifestation amongst His servants and the revelation of His Cause to His creation. To this testify faithful servants. We have revealed in the earth that which appeared before and that which had not appeared, yet most of the people do not understand. When verses are sent down to them, they say: “These are forgeries,” and when there appeareth a matter which the servants are powerless to accomplish, they say: “This is manifest sorcery.” They have lost who denied God’s proof and His authority, and he hath prospered who turned toward His extended path. We have called all purely for the sake of God to the Dawning-Place of revelation, yet they turned away and objected, following every rejected ignorant one. Be thou thankful to God for having been mentioned by this Pen through which the world hath been set ablaze with the love of God, the Lord of eternity, and the seal of the choice sealed wine hath been broken.

=== START BH06615 ===

Concerning Aqa Muhammad ibn-i-Haji, upon him be the Most Ancient, Most Great Glory of God. Blessed is he who limits affairs to the remembrance of his Lord and attains unto this sealed wine. Verily, he who enjoins what is right and acts accordingly has indeed attained unto the wine, while he who forbids it is among the most lost. However, this must be done with wisdom and utterance, not in such way as would raise an uproar in creation. Verily, He is the Forgiving, the Merciful. Associate amongst yourselves with love and affection, and be not of those who search into people’s deeds to find fault with them. By My life! Such people are among the heedless. Do not pronounce as infidels those who have recognized God, and curse not those who recite the verses of God with humility. Thus does the Pen of your Lord, the All-Knowing, the All-Wise, counsel you. Say: If you avoid grievous sins, then do what you have been commanded in the Book of God, the Evident, the All-Knowing. We have perceived the fragrance of thy love and have sent down unto thee this mighty Tablet. Neither treasures nor mines, nor whatsoever hath been created in the heavens and earth, can equal it. When thou hast attained unto it, say: Praise be unto Thee, O Thou Who art wronged, foreign, and alone.

=== END BH06615 ===

=== START BH06616 ===

In the Name of Him Who seeth and heareth!

Blessed is he who is just in the Cause of God and uttereth the truth when the Desired One appeareth with sovereignty that hath subdued all who are in the heavens and on earth. And woe unto the heedless!

Look ye upon others as ye look upon yourselves. This is the way of God, were ye among them that know. This is the religion of God, were ye among them that hear.

O people! Cast aside your vain imaginings and take hold of that which ye behold illumined with the lights of certitude. Thus hath the sun of knowledge shone forth from the horizon of the utterance of your Lord, the All-Wise.

Say: O people! Fear God and oppose not Him through Whom God hath come upon the clouds and through Whom the Book hath spoken. Verily, there is no God but Him, the All-Knowing, the All-Informed.

=== START BH06617 ===

O Haji Aqa Kuchik, upon him be the Glory of God! In My Name, the Rememberer and the Remembered! Heedlessness hath encompassed the world and prevented all from the Most Exalted Horizon, save those souls who are immersed in the ocean of divine love. These souls prefer one atom of tribulation in His path above all that is in the world. These are they who are accounted as the people of Baha in the Book of Names. Blessed are they, for they have attained unto that which God, exalted be His glory, hath ever announced through the tongue of the Prophets and Messengers. Great indeed is this Day, and its greatness hath been revealed by the Supreme Pen in the Scriptures and Tablets.
